peripherals.name: monitor
peripherals.description: The monitor module for advanced displays in ComputerCraft.
peripherals.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- Writing text to the monitor
- Clearing the monitor
- Setting colors
- Cursor manipulation

functions.name: setTextScale
functions.description: Sets the text scale on the monitor.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: The text scale (e.g., 0.5, 1, 2)

functions.name: getTextScale
functions.description: Gets the current text scale of the monitor.

returns.name: scale
returns.description: The current text scale

functions.example:
local scale = monitor.getTextScale()
print("Current text scale: " .. scale)

functions.name: write
functions.description: Writes text to the monitor.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to write

functions.name: scroll
functions.description: Scrolls the monitor content by the specified number of lines.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The number of lines to scroll (positive to scroll down, negative to scroll up)

functions.name: getCursorPos
functions.description: Returns the current cursor position as x, y coordinates.

returns.name: x
returns.description: The x coordinate

returns.name: y
returns.description: The y coordinate

functions.example:
local x, y = monitor.getCursorPos()
print("Cursor at: " .. x .. ", " .. y)

functions.name: setCursorPos
functions.description: Sets the cursor position on the monitor.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x coordinate (1-based)

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y coordinate (1-based)

functions.name: getCursorBlink
functions.description: Returns whether the cursor blink is enabled on the monitor.

returns.name: blink
returns.description: true if cursor blink is enabled, false otherwise

functions.example:
local blink = monitor.getCursorBlink()
print("Cursor blink is " .. (blink and "enabled" or "disabled"))

functions.name: setCursorBlink
functions.description: Enables or disables the cursor blink on the monitor.

parameters.name: blink
parameters.description: true to enable cursor blink, false to disable

functions.name: getSize
functions.description: Get the size of the terminal.

returns.name: width
returns.description: The width of the terminal

returns.name: height
returns.description: The height of the terminal

functions.example:
local width, height = monitor.getSize()
print("Monitor size: " .. width .. "x" .. height)

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Clears the terminal, filling it with the current background colour.

functions.name: clearLine
functions.description: Clears the current line, filling it with the current background colour.

functions.name: getTextColour
functions.description: Return the colour that new text will be written as.

returns.name: colour
returns.description: The current text colour

functions.example:
local colour = monitor.getTextColour()
print("Current text colour: " .. colour)

functions.name: setTextColour
functions.description: Set the colour that new text will be written as.

parameters.name: colour
parameters.description: The text colour to set

functions.example: monitor.setTextColour(32768)  -- Set text colour to blue

functions.name: getBackgroundColour
functions.description: Return the current background colour. This is used when writing text and clearing the terminal.

returns.name: colour
returns.description: The current background colour

functions.example:
local colour = monitor.getBackgroundColour()
print("Current background colour: " .. colour)

functions.name: setBackgroundColour
functions.description: Set the current background colour. This is used when writing text and clearing the terminal.

parameters.name: colour
parameters.description: The background colour to set

functions.example: monitor.setBackgroundColour(16384)  -- Set background colour to green

functions.name: isColour
functions.description: Determine if this terminal supports colour. Terminals which do not support colour will still allow writing coloured text/backgrounds, but it will be displayed in greyscale.

returns.name: colour
returns.description: true if the monitor supports colour, false otherwise

functions.example:
if monitor.isColour() then
  print("Monitor supports colour")
else
  print("Monitor is monochrome")
end

functions.name: isColour
functions.description: Determine if this terminal supports colour. Terminals which do not support colour will still allow writing coloured text/backgrounds, but it will be displayed in greyscale.

returns.name: colour
returns.description: true if the monitor supports colour, false otherwise

functions.example:
if monitor.isColour() then
  print("Monitor supports colour")
else
  print("Monitor is monochrome")
end

functions.name: blit
functions.signature: monitor.blit(text: string, textColour: string, backgroundColour: string): nil
functions.description: Writes text to the monitor with per-character colours.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to write

parameters.name: textColour
parameters.description: A string of hexadecimal digits representing the text colour for each character

parameters.name: backgroundColour
parameters.description: A string of hexadecimal digits representing the background colour for each character

functions.name: setPaletteColour
functions.signature: monitor.setPaletteColour(colour: number, r: number, g: number, b: number): nil
functions.description: Set the palette for a specific colour.

parameters.name: colour
parameters.description: The colour index to set (0-15)

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: Red component (0.0 - 1.0)

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: Green component (0.0 - 1.0)

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: Blue component (0.0 - 1.0)

functions.name: getPaletteColour
functions.description: Get the palette for a specific colour.

parameters.name: colour
parameters.description: The colour index to get (0-15)

returns.name: r
returns.description: Red component (0.0 - 1.0)

returns.name: g
returns.description: Green component (0.0 - 1.0)

returns.name: b
returns.description: Blue component (0.0 - 1.0)

functions.example:
local r, g, b = monitor.getPaletteColour(1)
print("Colour 1 RGB: " .. r .. ", " .. g .. ", " .. b)

peripherals.name: printer
peripherals.description: The printer peripheral for printing text and graphics.
peripherals.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- Printing text to pages
- Managing cursor position
- Handling ink and paper levels
- Creating and finalizing pages

functions.name: write
functions.description: Writes text to the current page.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The value to write to the page.

functions.name: getCursorPos
functions.description: Returns the current position of the cursor on the page.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The X position of the cursor.

returns.name: value2
returns.description: The Y position of the cursor.

functions.name: setCursorPos
functions.description: Sets the position of the cursor on the page.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X coordinate to set the cursor at.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y coordinate to set the cursor at.

functions.name: getPageSize
functions.description: Returns the size of the current page.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The width of the page.

returns.name: value2
returns.description: The height of the page.

functions.name: newPage
functions.description: Starts printing a new page.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether a new page could be started.

functions.name: endPage
functions.description: Finalizes printing of the current page and outputs it to the tray.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether the page could be successfully finished.

functions.name: setPageTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the current page.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: ?  The title to set for the page.

functions.name: getInkLevel
functions.description: Returns the amount of ink left in the printer.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The amount of ink available to print with.

functions.name: getPaperLevel
functions.description: Returns the amount of paper left in the printer.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The amount of paper available to print with.

peripherals.name: modem
peripherals.description: Modems allow you to send messages between computers over long distances.
peripherals.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- connecting to other modems
- transmitting messages
- calling methods
- geting names

functions.name: open
functions.description:
Open a channel on a modem. A channel must be open in order to receive messages. Modems can have up to 128
channels open at one time.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The channel to open. This must be a number between 0 and 65535.

functions.name: isOpen
functions.description: Check if a channel is open.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The channel to check.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether the channel is open.

functions.name: close
functions.description: Close an open channel, meaning it will no longer receive messages.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The channel to close.

functions.name: closeAll
functions.description: Close all open channels.

functions.name: transmit
functions.signature: modem.transmit(channel: number, replyChannel: number, payload: any): nil
functions.description:
Sends a modem message on a certain channel. Modems listening on the channel will queue a modem_message
event on adjacent computers.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The channel to send messages on.

parameters.name: replyChannel
parameters.description:
The channel that responses to this message should be sent on. This can be the same as
channel or entirely different. The channel must have been opened on
the sending computer in order to receive the replies.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description:
The object to send. This can be any primitive type (boolean, number, string) as well as
tables. Other types (like functions), as well as metatables, will not be transmitted.

functions.name: isWireless
functions.description: Determine if this is a wired or wireless modem.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: true if this is a wireless modem.

functions.name: getNamesRemote
functions.description: List all remote peripherals on the wired network.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: { ... } Remote peripheral names on the network.

functions.name: isPresentRemote
functions.description: Determine if a peripheral is available on this wired network.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The peripheral's name.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: boolean If a peripheral is present with the given name.

functions.name: getTypeRemote
functions.description: Get the type of a peripheral is available on this wired network.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The peripheral's name.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil The peripheral's type, or nil if it is not present.

functions.name: hasTypeRemote
functions.description: Check a peripheral is of a particular type.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The peripheral's name.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type to check.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil If a peripheral has a particular type, or nil if it is not present.

functions.name: getMethodsRemote
functions.description: Get all available methods for the remote peripheral with the given name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The peripheral's name.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: { ... } | nil A list of methods provided by this peripheral, or nil if it is not present.

functions.name: callRemote
functions.description: Call a method on a peripheral on this wired network.

parameters.name: remoteName
parameters.description: The name of the peripheral to invoke the method on.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The return values of the peripheral method.

functions.name: getNameLocal
functions.description:
Returns the network name of the current computer, if the modem is on. This
may be used by other computers on the network to wrap this computer as a
peripheral.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil The current computer's name on the wired network.

peripherals.name: drive
peripherals.description: Disk drives are a peripheral which allow you to read and write to floppy disks and other mountable media (such as computers or turtles). They also allow you to play records.
peripherals.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- reading disks
- playing audio
- setting data
- creating disks

functions.name: isDiskPresent
functions.description: Returns whether a disk is currently inserted in the drive.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether a disk is currently inserted in the drive.

functions.name: getDiskLabel
functions.description: Returns the label of the disk in the drive if available.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil The label of the disk, or nil if either no disk is inserted or the disk doesn't have a label.

functions.name: setDiskLabel
functions.description: Sets or clears the label for a disk.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: ?  The new label of the disk, or nil to clear.

functions.name: hasData
functions.description: Returns whether a disk with data is inserted.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether a disk with data is inserted.

functions.name: getMountPath
functions.description: Returns the mount path for the inserted disk.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil The mount path for the disk, or nil if no data disk is inserted.

functions.name: hasAudio
functions.description: Returns whether a disk with audio is inserted.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether a disk with audio is inserted.

functions.name: getAudioTitle
functions.description: Returns the title of the inserted audio disk.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil | false The title of the audio, false if no disk is inserted, or nil if the disk has no audio.

functions.name: playAudio
functions.description: Plays the audio in the inserted disk, if available.

functions.name: stopAudio
functions.description: Stops any audio that may be playing.

functions.name: ejectDisk
functions.description: Ejects any disk that may be in the drive.

functions.name: getDiskID
functions.description: Returns the ID of the disk inserted in the drive.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil The ID of the disk in the drive, or nil if no disk with an ID is inserted.

peripherals.name: command
peripherals.description: This peripheral allows you to interact with command blocks.
peripherals.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- interacting with command blocks

functions.name: getCommand
functions.description: Get the command this command block will run.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The current command.

functions.name: setCommand
functions.description: Set the command block's command.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The new command.

functions.name: runCommand
functions.description: Execute the command block once.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: If the command completed successfully.

returns.name: value2
returns.description: | nil A failure message.

peripherals.name: redstone_relay
peripherals.description: The redstone relay is a peripheral that allows reading and outputting redstone signals.
peripherals.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- getting input
- setting signal strenght
- cable inputs
- testing inputs

functions.name: setOutput
functions.description: Turn the redstone signal of a specific side on or off.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to set.

parameters.name: on
parameters.description: Whether the redstone signal should be on or off. When on, a signal strength of 15 is emitted.

functions.name: getOutput
functions.description: Get the current redstone output of a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether the redstone output is on or off.

functions.name: getInput
functions.description: Get the current redstone input of a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether the redstone input is on or off.

functions.name: setAnalogOutput
functions.description: Set the redstone signal strength for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The signal strength between 0 and 15.

functions.name: setAnalogueOutput
functions.description: Set the redstone signal strength for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The signal strength between 0 and 15.

functions.name: getAnalogOutput
functions.description: Get the redstone output signal strength for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The output signal strength, between 0 and 15.

functions.name: getAnalogueOutput
functions.description: Get the redstone output signal strength for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The output signal strength, between 0 and 15.

functions.name: getAnalogInput
functions.description: Get the redstone input signal strength for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The input signal strength, between 0 and 15.

functions.name: getAnalogueInput
functions.description: Get the redstone input signal strength for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The input signal strength, between 0 and 15.

functions.name: setBundledOutput
functions.description: Set the bundled cable output for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to set.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: The colour bitmask to set.

functions.name: getBundledOutput
functions.description: Get the bundled cable output for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The bundle cable's output.

functions.name: getBundledInput
functions.description: Get the bundled cable input for a specific side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The bundle cable's input.

functions.name: testBundledInput
functions.description: Determine if a specific combination of colours are on for the given side.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: The side to test.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: The mask to test.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: If the colours are on.

peripherals.name: speaker
peripherals.description: The speaker peripheral allows your computer to play notes and other sounds.

functions.name: playNote
functions.signature: speaker.playNote(instrument: string, volume: number?, pitch: number?): boolean
functions.description: Plays a note block note through the speaker.

parameters.name: instrument
parameters.description: The instrument to use to play this note.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: ?  The volume to play the note at, from 0.0 to 3.0. Defaults to 1.0.

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.description: ?  The pitch to play the note at in semitones, from 0 to 24. Defaults to 12.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether the note could be played as the limit was reached.

functions.name: playSound
functions.signature: speaker.playSound(name: string, volume: number?, pitch: number?): boolean
functions.description: Plays a Minecraft sound through the speaker.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the sound to play.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: ?  The volume to play the sound at, from 0.0 to 3.0. Defaults to 1.0.

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.description: ?  The speed to play the sound at, from 0.5 to 2.0. Defaults to 1.0.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether the sound could be played.

functions.name: playAudio
functions.description: Attempt to stream some audio data to the speaker.

parameters.name: audio
parameters.description: { ... } A list of amplitudes.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description:
?  The volume to play this audio at. If not given, defaults to the previous volume
given to playAudio.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: If there was room to accept this audio data.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stop all audio being played by this speaker.

peripherals.name: Handle
peripherals.description: A file handle which can be read or written to.
peripherals.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- reading from files
- writing to files
- seeking within files
- closing files

functions.name: close
functions.description: Close this file handle, freeing any resources it uses.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: true if the file was closed successfully, false otherwise

functions.name: flush
functions.description: Flush any buffered output, forcing it to be written to the file

functions.name: lines
functions.description: Returns an iterator that, each time it is called, returns a new line from the file.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The next line from the file, or nil if the end of the file has been reached.

functions.example:
for line in file:lines() do
  print(line)
end

functions.name: read
functions.description: Reads data from the file, using the specified formats. For each format provided, the function returns either the data read, or nil if no data could be read.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The data read from the file, or nil if no data could be read.

functions.name: seek
functions.description: Sets the file position indicator for the file handle.

parameters.name: whence
parameters.description: The reference point for the offset. This may be 'set' (the beginning of the file), 'cur' (the current position), or 'end' (the end of the file).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
?  The number of bytes to offset from the reference point. May be negative.
If not given, defaults to 0.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The new file position.

functions.name: write
functions.description: Writes the specified data to the file.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to write to the file.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: true if the data was written successfully, false otherwise

peripherals.name: energy_storage
peripherals.description: Methods for interacting with blocks which store energy.
peripherals.documentation: This works with energy storage blocks, as well as generators and machines which consume energy.

functions.name: getEnergy
functions.description: Get the energy of this block.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The energy stored in this block, in FE.

functions.name: getEnergyCapacity
functions.description: Get the maximum amount of energy this block can store.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The energy capacity of this block.

peripherals.name: fluid_storage
peripherals.description: Methods for interacting with tanks and other fluid storage blocks.

functions.name: tanks
functions.description: Get all "tanks" in this fluid storage.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: {  | nil... } Basic information about all fluids in this fluid storage.

functions.name: pushFluid
functions.signature: fluid_storage.pushFluid(toName: string, limit: number?, fluidName: string?): number
functions.description: Move a fluid from one fluid container to another connected one.

parameters.name: toName
parameters.description:
The name of the peripheral/container to push to. This is the string given to peripheral.wrap,
and displayed by the wired modem.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: ?  The maximum amount of fluid to move.

parameters.name: fluidName
parameters.description: ?  The fluid to move. If not given, an arbitrary fluid will be chosen.

returns.name: value1

globals.name: sleep
globals.description: Pauses execution for the specified number of seconds.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
The number of seconds to sleep for, rounded up to the
nearest multiple of 0.05.

globals.name: write
globals.description:
Writes a line of text to the screen without a newline at the end, wrapping
text if necessary.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to write to the string

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The number of lines written

globals.name: print
globals.description:
Prints the specified values to the screen separated by spaces, wrapping if
necessary. After printing, the cursor is moved to the next line.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The number of lines written

globals.name: printError
globals.description:
Prints the specified values to the screen in red, separated by spaces,
wrapping if necessary. After printing, the cursor is moved to the next line.

globals.name: read
globals.signature: read(replaceChar: string?, history: table?, completeFn: string?, default: string?): string
globals.description:
Reads user input from the terminal. This automatically handles arrow keys,
pasting, character replacement, history scrollback, auto-completion, and
default values.

parameters.name: replaceChar
parameters.description:
?  A character to replace each typed character with.
This can be used for hiding passwords, for example.

parameters.name: history
parameters.description:
?  A table holding history items that can be scrolled
back to with the up/down arrow keys. The oldest item is at index 1, while the
newest item is at the highest index.

parameters.name: completeFn
parameters.description:
? function(partial: ):{ string... } | nil A function
to be used for completion. This function should take the partial text typed so
far, and returns a list of possible completion options.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description:
?  Default text which should already be entered into
the prompt.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The text typed in.

modules.name: term
modules.description: The terminal module for all computers in ComputerCraft.
modules.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- Writing text to the screen
- Clearing the screen
- Setting colors
- Cursor manipulation

functions.name: print
functions.description: Prints a message to the terminal.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to print

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Clears the terminal screen.

functions.name: setCursorPos
functions.description: Sets the cursor position on the terminal.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x coordinate (1-based)

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y coordinate (1-based)

functions.name: getCursorPos
functions.description: Returns the current cursor position as x, y coordinates.

returns.name: x
returns.description: The x coordinate

returns.name: y
returns.description: The y coordinate

functions.example:
local x, y = term.getCursorPos()
print("Cursor at: " .. x .. ", " .. y)

modules.name: turtle
modules.description: The turtle API for controlling turtles in ComputerCraft.
modules.documentation:
Provides functions for:
- Movement (forward, back, up, down)
- Rotation (turnLeft, turnRight)
- Block interaction (dig, place, drop)
- Inventory management

functions.name: forward
functions.description: Moves the turtle forward one block.

returns.name: success
returns.description: true if successful, false otherwise

returns.name: reason
returns.description: Error message if failed

functions.example:
if turtle.forward() then
  print("Moved forward")
else
  print("Blocked")
end

functions.name: back
functions.description: Moves the turtle backward one block.

returns.name: success
returns.description: true if successful, false otherwise

returns.name: reason
returns.description: Error message if failed

modules.name: peripheral
modules.description: Find and control peripherals attached to this computer.
modules.documentation:

- geting peripheral types
- call methods

returns.name: value1

modules.name: keys
modules.description: Constants for all keyboard key codes, as queued by the key event.
modules.documentation: These values are not guaranteed to remain the same between versions. It is recommended that you use the constants provided by this file, rather than the underlying numerical values.

Translates a numerical key code to a human-readable name. The human-readable
name is one of the constants in the keys API.

parameters.description: The key code to look up.

returns.name: value1

modules.name: multishell
modules.description: Multishell allows multiple programs to be run at the same time.
modules.documentation: When multiple programs are running, it displays a tab bar at the top of the screen, which allows you to switch between programs. New programs can be launched using the fg or bg programs, or using the shell.openTab and multishell.launch functions.

functions.name: getFocus
functions.description:
Get the currently visible process. This will be the one selected on
the tab bar.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The currently visible process's index.

functions.name: setFocus
functions.description: Change the currently visible process.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The process index to switch to.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
If the process was changed successfully. This will
return false if there is no process with this id.

functions.name: getTitle
functions.description: Get the title of the given tab.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The process index.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
| nil The current process title, or nil if the
process doesn't exist.

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Set the title of the given process.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The process index.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The new process title.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Get the index of the currently running process.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The currently running process.

functions.name: launch
functions.description: Start a new process, with the given environment, program and arguments.

parameters.name: tProgramEnv
parameters.description: The environment to load the path under.

parameters.name: sProgramPath
parameters.description: The path to the program to run.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The index of the created process.

functions.name: getCount
functions.description: Get the number of processes within this multishell.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The number of processes.

modules.name: os
modules.description: The os API allows interacting with the current computer.

functions.name: loadAPI
functions.description:
When possible it's best to avoid using this function. It pollutes
the global table and can mask errors.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the API to load.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether or not the API was successfully loaded.

functions.name: unloadAPI
functions.description: See os.loadAPI for why.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the API to unload.

functions.name: pullEvent
functions.description:
Pause execution of the current thread and waits for any events matching
filter.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: ?  Event to filter for.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: event The name of the event that fired.

returns.name: value2
returns.description: param... Optional additional parameters of the event.

functions.name: pullEventRaw
functions.description:
Pause execution of the current thread and waits for events, including the
terminate event.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: ?  Event to filter for.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: event The name of the event that fired.

returns.name: value2
returns.description: param... Optional additional parameters of the event.

functions.name: sleep
functions.description: Pauses execution for the specified number of seconds, alias of _G.sleep.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
The number of seconds to sleep for, rounded up to the
nearest multiple of 0.05.

functions.name: version
functions.description: Get the current CraftOS version (for example, CraftOS 1.9).

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The current CraftOS version.

functions.name: run
functions.description:
Run the program at the given path with the specified environment and
arguments.

parameters.name: env
parameters.description: The environment to run the program with.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The exact path of the program to run.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: Whether or not the program ran successfully.

functions.name: queueEvent
functions.description:
Adds an event to the event queue. This event can later be pulled with
os.pullEvent.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the event to queue.

functions.name: startTimer
functions.description:
Starts a timer that will run for the specified number of seconds. Once
the timer fires, a timer event will be added to the queue with the ID
returned from this function as the first parameter.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The number of seconds until the timer fires.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
The ID of the new timer. This can be used to filter the timer
event, or cancel the timer.

functions.name: cancelTimer
functions.description:
Cancels a timer previously started with startTimer. This
will stop the timer from firing.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The ID of the timer to cancel.

functions.name: setAlarm
functions.description:
Sets an alarm that will fire at the specified in-game time.
When it fires, an alarm event will be added to the event queue with the
ID returned from this function as the first parameter.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time at which to fire the alarm, in the range [0.0, 24.0).

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
The ID of the new alarm. This can be used to filter the
alarm event, or cancel the alarm.

functions.name: cancelAlarm
functions.description:
Cancels an alarm previously started with setAlarm. This will stop the
alarm from firing.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The ID of the alarm to cancel.

functions.name: shutdown
functions.description: Shuts down the computer immediately.

functions.name: reboot
functions.description: Reboots the computer immediately.

functions.name: getComputerID
functions.description: Returns the ID of the computer.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The ID of the computer.

functions.name: computerID
functions.description: Returns the ID of the computer.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The ID of the computer.

functions.name: getComputerLabel
functions.description: Returns the label of the computer, or nil if none is set.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil The label of the computer.

functions.name: computerLabel
functions.description: Returns the label of the computer, or nil if none is set.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: | nil The label of the computer.

functions.name: setComputerLabel
functions.description: Set the label of this computer.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: ?  The new label. May be nil in order to clear it.

functions.name: clock
functions.description: Returns the number of seconds that the computer has been running.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The computer's uptime.

functions.name: time
functions.description:
Returns the current time depending on the string passed in. This will
always be in the range [0.0, 24.0).

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: ?  | table The locale of the time, or a table filled by os.date("*t") to decode. Defaults to ingame locale if not specified.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The hour of the selected locale, or a UNIX timestamp from the table, depending on the argument passed in.

functions.name: day
functions.description: Returns the day depending on the locale specified.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: ?  The locale to get the day for. Defaults to ingame if not set.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The day depending on the selected locale.

functions.name: epoch
functions.description: Returns the number of milliseconds since an epoch depending on the locale.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: ?  The locale to get the milliseconds for. Defaults to ingame if not set.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The milliseconds since the epoch depending on the selected locale.

functions.name: date
functions.description:
Returns a date string (or table) using a specified format string and
optional time to format.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: ?  The format of the string to return. This defaults to %c, which expands to a string similar to "Sat Dec 24 16:58:00 2011".

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: ?  The timestamp to convert to a string. This defaults to the current time.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The resulting formated string, or table.

modules.name: parallel
modules.description: A simple way to run several functions at once.
modules.documentation: Functions are not actually executed simultaneously, but rather this API will automatically switch between them whenever they yield (e.g. whenever they call coroutine.yield, or functions that call that - such as os.pullEvent - or functions that call that, etc - basically, anything that causes the function to pause).

functions.name: waitForAny
functions.description:
Switches between execution of the functions, until any of them
finishes. If any of the functions errors, the message is propagated upwards
from the parallel.waitForAny call.

parameters.description: The functions this task will run

functions.name: waitForAll
functions.description:
Switches between execution of the functions, until all of them are
finished. If any of the functions errors, the message is propagated upwards
from the parallel.waitForAll call.

parameters.description: The functions this task will run

modules.name: pocket
modules.description: Control the current pocket computer, adding or removing upgrades.
modules.documentation: This API is only available on pocket computers. As such, you may use its presence to determine what kind of computer you are using

functions.name: equipBack
functions.description: Search the player's inventory for another upgrade, replacing the existing one with that item if found.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: If an item was equipped.

returns.name: value2
returns.description: | nil The reason an item was not equipped.

functions.name: unequipBack
functions.description: Remove the pocket computer's current upgrade.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: If the upgrade was unequipped.

returns.name: value2
returns.description: | nil The reason an upgrade was not unequipped.

modules.name: rednet
modules.description: Communicate with other computers by using modems. rednet provides a layer of abstraction on top of the main modem peripheral, making it slightly easier to use.

functions.name: open
functions.description:
Opens a modem with the given peripheral name, allowing it to send and
receive messages over rednet.

parameters.name: modem
parameters.description: The name of the modem to open.

functions.name: close
functions.description:
Close a modem with the given peripheral name, meaning it can no longer
send and receive rednet messages.

parameters.name: modem
parameters.description:
?  The side the modem exists on. If not given, all
open modems will be closed.

functions.name: isOpen
functions.description: Determine if rednet is currently open.

parameters.name: modem
parameters.description:
?  Which modem to check. If not given, all connected
modems will be checked.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: If the given modem is open.

functions.name: send
functions.description:
Allows a computer or turtle with an attached modem to send a message
intended for a computer with a specific ID. At least one such modem must first
be opened before sending is possible.

parameters.name: recipient
parameters.description: The ID of the receiving computer.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description:
?  The "protocol" to send this message under. When
using rednet.receive one can filter to only receive messages sent under a
particular protocol.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
If this message was successfully sent (i.e. if rednet is
currently open). Note, this does not guarantee the message was
actually received.

functions.name: broadcast
functions.description:
Broadcasts a string message over the predefined CHANNEL_BROADCAST
channel. The message will be received by every device listening to rednet.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description:
?  The "protocol" to send this message under. When
using rednet.receive one can filter to only receive messages sent under a
particular protocol.

functions.name: receive
functions.signature: rednet.receive(protocol_filter: string?, timeout: number?): number, string
functions.description:
Wait for a rednet message to be received, or until nTimeout seconds have
elapsed.

parameters.name: protocol_filter
parameters.description:
?  The protocol the received message must be
sent with. If specified, any messages not sent under this protocol will be
discarded.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
?  The number of seconds to wait if no message is
received.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The computer which sent this message

returns.name: value3
returns.description: | nil The protocol this message was sent under.

functions.name: host
functions.description:
Register the system as "hosting" the desired protocol under the specified
name. If a rednet lookup is performed for that protocol (and
maybe name) on the same network, the registered system will automatically
respond via a background process, hence providing the system performing the
lookup with its ID number.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The protocol this computer provides.

parameters.name: hostname
parameters.description: The name this computer exposes for the given protocol.

functions.name: unhost
functions.description:
Stop hosting a specific protocol, meaning it will no longer
respond to rednet.lookup requests.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The protocol to unregister your self from.

functions.name: lookup
functions.description:
Search the local rednet network for systems hosting the
desired protocol and returns any computer IDs that respond as "registered"
against it.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The protocol to search for.

parameters.name: hostname
parameters.description: ?  The hostname to search for.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: ... A list of computer IDs hosting the given protocol.

functions.name: run
functions.description:
Listen for modem messages and converts them into rednet messages, which may
then be received.

returns.description: The output signal strength, between 0 and 15.

functions.name: getAnalogInput
functions.description: Get the redstone input signal strength for a specific side.

parameters.description: The side to get.

functions.name: getAnalogueInput

functions.name: setBundledOutput

modules.name: settings
modules.description: Read and write configuration options for CraftOS and your programs.

functions.name: define
functions.description: Define a new setting, optional specifying various properties about it.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of this option

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
? { description? = , default? = any, type? = string } Options for this setting. This table accepts the following fields:

description: A description which may be printed when running the set program.
default: A default value, which is returned by settings.get if the
setting has not been changed.
type: Require values to be of this type. Setting the value to another type
will error. Must be one of: "number", "string", "boolean", or "table".

functions.name: undefine
functions.description: Remove a definition of a setting.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of this option

functions.name: set
functions.description: Set the value of a setting.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the setting to set

functions.name: get
functions.description: Get the value of a setting.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the setting to get.

functions.name: getDetails
functions.description: Get details about a specific setting.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the setting to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
{ description? = , default? = any, type? = string, value? = any } Information about this setting. This includes all information from settings.define,
as well as this setting's value.

functions.name: unset
functions.description: Remove the value of a setting, setting it to the default.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the setting to unset.

functions.name: clear
functions.description:
Resets the value of all settings. Equivalent to calling settings.unset
on every setting.

functions.name: getNames
functions.description: Get the names of all currently defined settings.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
{  } An alphabetically sorted list of all currently-defined
settings.

functions.name: load
functions.description: Load settings from the given file.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: ?  = ".settings" The file to load from.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
Whether settings were successfully read from this
file. Reasons for failure may include the file not existing or being
corrupted.

functions.name: save
functions.description: Save settings to the given file.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: ?  = ".settings" The path to save settings to.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: If the settings were successfully saved.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
? { nbt_style? = , unicode_strings? = boolean, allow_repetitions? = boolean } Options for serialisation.

nbt_style: Whether to produce NBT-style JSON (non-quoted keys) instead of standard JSON.
unicode_strings: Whether to treat strings as containing UTF-8 characters instead of
using the default 8-bit character set.
allow_repetitions: Relax the check for recursive tables, allowing them to appear multiple
times (as long as tables do not appear inside themselves).

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The JSON representation of the input.

unicode_strings: Whether to treat strings as containing UTF-8 characters instead of
using the default 8-bit character set.
allow_repetitions: Relax the check for recursive tables, allowing them to appear multiple
times (as long as tables do not appear inside themselves).

functions.description: Converts a serialised JSON string back into a reassembled Lua object.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The serialised string to deserialise.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
? { nbt_style? = , parse_null? = boolean, parse_empty_array? = boolean } Options which control how this JSON object is parsed.

nbt_style: When true, this will accept stringified NBT strings,
as produced by many commands.
parse_null: When true, null will be parsed as json_null, rather than
nil.
parse_empty_array: When false, empty arrays will be parsed as a new table.
By default (or when this value is true), they are parsed as empty_json_array.

modules.name: turtle

The turtle's inventory should set up like a crafting grid. For instance, to
craft sticks, slots 1 and 5 should contain planks. All other slots should be
empty, including those outside the crafting "grid".

modules.name: window
modules.description: A terminal redirect occupying a smaller area of an existing terminal. This allows for easy definition of spaces within the display that can be written/drawn to, then later redrawn/repositioned/etc as need be.

functions.name: create
functions.signature: window.create(parent: Redirect, nX: number, nY: number, nWidth: number, nHeight: number, bStartVisible: boolean?): Window
functions.description:
Returns a terminal object that is a space within the specified parent
terminal object. This can then be used (or even redirected to) in the same
manner as eg a wrapped monitor. Refer to the term API for a list of
functions available to it.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The parent terminal redirect to draw to.

parameters.name: nX
parameters.description: The x coordinate this window is drawn at in the parent terminal

parameters.name: nY
parameters.description: The y coordinate this window is drawn at in the parent terminal

parameters.name: nWidth
parameters.description: The width of this window

parameters.name: nHeight
parameters.description: The height of this window

parameters.name: bStartVisible
parameters.description:
?  Whether this window is visible by
default. Defaults to true.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: The constructed window
